H0.text: what kind of language do egyptian speak. Egyptian Arabic

H1.text: what kind of language do egyptian speak. Coptic

H2.text: what kind of language do egyptian speak. Nubian

H3.text: what kind of language do egyptian speak. Modern Standard Arabic

A4.text: Egyptian Arabic is the most widely spoken vernacular Arabic variety in Egypt.

A5.text: Egyptian Arabic is used in most social situations, with Modern Standard and Classical Arabic generally being used only in writing and in highly religious and/or formal situations.

A6.text: Literary Arabic is the official language of Egypt.

A7.text: In the far-Southern Upper Nile Valley, around Kom Ombo and Aswan, there are about 300,000 speakers of Nubian languages, mainly Nobiin, but also Kenuzi.
